docs.snippet: SEA ISLAND, Ga., Jan. 17 (AP) -- Louise Suggs of Atlanta fired her third straight 77 today to win the Sea Island women's open golf tournament with a 54-hole score of 231.

headline.main: Miss Suggs Triumphs With 231 In Sea Island Open Tournament

docs.snippet: TAMPA, Fla., Jan. 21 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg, S. C. shot even-par 75 today to take a two-stroke lead after the first round of the $5,000 Tampa women's open golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla., Jan. 21 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg, S. C. shot even-par 75 today to take a two-stroke lead after the first round of the $5,000 Tampa women's open golf tournament.

docs.snippet: An open letter to the Protestant Evangelical Confederation of Colombia has been adopted here by the General Board of the National Council of the Churches of Christ in the U. S. A. The letter censures the Colombian Government for alleged maltreatment...
docs.lead_paragraph: An open letter to the Protestant Evangelical Confederation of Colombia has been adopted here by the General Board of the National Council of the Churches of Christ in the U. S. A. The letter censures the Colombian Government for alleged maltreatment of Protestants in that country.
docs.abstract: Rev Dr O F Nolde to attend

headline.main: NATIONAL COUNCIL SCORES COLOMBIA; Open Letter to Protestants There Quotes a Message by Pope on Religious Liberty

docs.snippet: TAMPA, Fla., Jan. 23 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls held a 3-stroke lead in the $5,000 Tampa women's open golf tournament today although she posted a 2-over-par 77 for a 54-hole score of 228.

headline.main: Miss Rawls Enjoys Three-Stroke Lead With 228 in Tampa Golf Tournament; PACE-SETTER GETS TWO-OVER-PAR 77
